author: wimcoekaerts
body:
in powershell on Linux (and windows) if I just type  "cd" then it doesn't do anything. on *nix in bash the default behavior is that it will go to $HOME

~ wcoekaer$ cd /tmp
tmp wcoekaer$ cd
~ wcoekaer$

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT what subsystem does `Set-Location` fall under? I want this feature request too. I believe @JamesWTruher has an overridden `cd` function to enable exactly this.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Steve is on sabbatical with limited access to the internet. I will take care of re-assigning it.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
The big question in UX sync is whether it's an egregious breaking change to make the default behavior of `Set-Location` to be `Set-Location ~` instead of `Set-Location .`

General sentiment was that, while this is definitely a breaking change, there's an expectation that script writers would not have intended to use `Set-Location` as shorthand for `Set-Location .`. We can gather feedback on Aug17 for whether or not people want this change (or if it breaks some pattern we didn't expect). 

There's also a desire to discuss `cd -`, but UX sync agrees that it can be done in the future.

title: just typing "cd" in powershell should go to $HOME (like bash)
